intro: Brachystele arechavaletae, commonly known as the Andean moss, is a rare and endemic species found in the cloud forests of the Andes. It belongs to the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rock surfaces or tree trunks. Its foliage is dense and features a distinctive coloration that varies with environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
